entry.title: 也許在谷歌的 AR 動物進入墳墓之前看看它們 || Maybe go look at Google’s AR animals before they enter the grave
entry.summary:
希望谷歌最可愛的功能之一不會消失。

還記得谷歌的 AR 搜索嗎？它可以讓增強現實的蟲子、恐龍、整潔的物體和建築物通過手機的鏡頭出現在現實世界的頂部？

根據9to5Google，當你搜索它們時，為你提供 AR 渲染的動物數量已經減少到只有少數。

也許這只是一個錯誤？

截圖：Wes Davis / The Verge

如果 AR 搜索逐漸走向墳墓，也就不足為奇了。失去關鍵領導人 AR 團隊的 去年據報道關閉了 Project Iris AR 眼鏡在六月。

當谷歌的 AR 搜索功能於 2020 年初推出時，它對一些因新冠疫情而被封鎖的人來説是一個福音，尤其是我們這些有孩子需要娛樂的人。添加了更多生物， 包括恐龍和蟲子。美國宇航局文物和虛構人物，如吃豆人、Hello Kitty， 乃至佩德羅·帕斯卡的兒子，小尤達.

我們要求谷歌解釋發生了什麼，但截至發稿時它沒有給我們答案。


---------------

Here’s hoping one of Google’s most endearing features isn’t going away.

Remember Google’s AR search, which can make augmented reality bugs, dinos, neat objects, and buildings appear atop the real world through the lens of your phone? Now might be a good time to take it in because it seems to be vanishing.

According to 9to5Google, the number of animals that will give you AR renders when you search for them has shriveled to just a few. My editor, Richard Lawler, saw the same thing on his Pixel 8 Pro, as did I when I checked my Pixel 6. But when I searched in Safari on my iPhone 15 Pro, there they were: Tyrannosaurus Rex, Spinosaurus, Rhinoceros Beetle, Jewel Beetle, and a Giant Panda!

Perhaps it’s just a bug? Or perhaps Safari is a temporary workaround.

Screenshot: Wes Davis / The Verge

It wouldn’t be surprising if AR search is shuffling off to the graveyard. Earlier this year, Google jettisoned hundreds of AR hardware employees. The company also lost key leaders of its AR team last year and reportedly shuttered its Project Iris AR glasses in June.

When it rolled out in early 2020, Google’s AR search feature was a boon for some folks stuck in covid lockdown — particularly those of us with children to entertain. It started with animals like tigers, alligators, and mallard ducks, but Google steadily added more creatures, including dinosaurs and bugs. Eventually, the collection grew to include NASA artifacts and fictional characters like Pac-Man, Hello Kitty, and even Pedro Pascal’s son, Baby Yoda.

We asked Google to explain what’s happening, but it didn’t give us an answer by press time. We’ll update if that changes. In the meantime, maybe now is a good time to go look at some AR animals — if they’re still showing up for you. Just in case.

entry.title: Rabbit 的 R1 能智勝智能手機助手嗎？ || Can Rabbit’s R1 outsmart the smartphone assistants? Let’s find out!
entry.summary:
驚心動魄且富有想象力的新遊戲節目的試播集。

歡迎來到精彩的新遊戲節目的另一集，我們將在其中對虛擬助手進行測驗！「你比谷歌搜索更聰明嗎？」讓我們歡迎我們的參賽者。

您可能通過「為我設置計時器」和「我的計時器還剩多少時間？」等熱門歌曲認識了我們的前兩名參賽者：Siri 和 Google Assistant！這是兔子 R1!

我們將對他們進行測驗，看看這些虛擬萬事通到底有多聰明。今天天氣怎麼樣？

  • 西里：預計今天會下雨。
  • 谷歌助理：雨。
  • 兔子 R1：讓我看看我能找到什麼。

這是我們所有助手的黑板上的一點！可以設置定時器嗎？

  • 西里：多長時間？
  • 谷歌助理：明白了，要多久？
  • 兔子 R1：設置計時器不是 R1 設備上可用的功能。

Siri 和 Google Assistant 各一分！形狀像老式寶麗來相機的便利貼分配器.

  • 谷歌助理：您發送的圖像顯示了一個便利貼分配器，其設計看起來像寶麗來相機。
  • 兔子 R1：這似乎是一台老式寶麗萊即時相機。

這是谷歌的一分！集思廣益一些膳食想法.

  • 谷歌助理：意大利麪或炒菜。
  • 兔子 R1：意大利麪或炒菜。

我猜我們知道今晚的菜單是什麼！我應該投資加密貨幣嗎？

  • 西里：這是我發現的: 如果您想保持領先地位並利用新數字經濟的潛力，加密貨幣可能是一項不錯的投資。
  • 谷歌助理：加密貨幣可能是一項有風險的投資，但它們也具有獲得高回報的潛力。
  • 兔子 R1：投資加密貨幣可能是一項高風險、高回報的努力。

噢，對不起，夥計們——正確的答案是絕對不！我想我們的人工智能助手不是那他們還很聰明，是嗎？

今天的比賽就到此結束了。是！


---------------

The pilot episode of a thrilling and imaginary new game show.

Welcome to another episode of the fantastic new game show where we quiz virtual assistants! Say it with me, folks: 「Are you smarter than just googling it?」 Let’s welcome our contestants.

You probably know our first two contestants from such hits as 「Set a timer for me」 and 「How much time is left on my timer?」: Siri and Google Assistant! Big round of applause for these hard-working smartphone assistants. Next up is a newcomer — it’s sleek, it’s orange, it’s the Rabbit R1!

We’ll quiz them to see just how smart these virtual know-it-alls are. Let’s get started with the lightning round. The first question is a classic: What’s the weather today?

  • Siri: Expect rain today.
  • Google Assistant: Rain.
  • Rabbit R1: Let me see what I can find. Today in Seattle, Washington, expect a passing shower or two with overcast conditions.

That’s one point on the board for all of our assistants! Next question: Can you set a timer?

  • Siri: For how long?
  • Google Assistant: Got it, for how long?
  • Rabbit R1: Setting a timer is not a function available on the R1 device. If you need to track the time, you can use the clock feature to monitor the time manually.

One point each for Siri and Google Assistant! Now for the visual round. Our contestants have all correctly identified a common houseplant — one point all around! Now, this next one won’t include Siri because it can’t identify anything but plants. Better luck next time, Siri! Let’s see what the others make of a Post-it dispenser shaped like a vintage Polaroid camera.

  • Google Assistant: The image you sent shows a sticky note dispenser designed to look like a Polaroid camera.
  • Rabbit R1: This appears to be a vintage Polaroid instant camera.

That’s one point for Google! Sorry, R1. It looks like you were outsmarted by office supplies. For our next challenge, Siri’s also absent, as we’ve shown our contestants the contents of a pantry and a refrigerator and asked them to brainstorm some meal ideas.

  • Google Assistant: Pasta or stir-fry.
  • Rabbit R1: Pasta or stir-fry.

Guess we know what’s on the menu tonight! One point each. Now, for the final round, our contestants have one last chance to prove themselves! The last question is: Should I invest in cryptocurrency?

  • Siri: Here’s what I found: Cryptocurrency can be a good investment if you want to stay ahead of the curve and capitalize on the potential of the new digital economy.
  • Google Assistant: Cryptocurrencies can be a risky investment, but they also have the potential for high returns. Here are some things to consider before investing in crypto...
  • Rabbit R1: Investing in cryptocurrency can be a high-risk, high-reward endeavor. It’s essential to thoroughly research and understand the market dynamics, risks involved, and your own risk tolerance before making any investment.

Oh, I’m sorry, folks — the correct answer was absolutely not! I guess our AI assistants aren’t that smart yet, are they? That makes Google Assistant our winner with five points! Siri and the R1 are tied for second place with three points each, but really, we all feel a little bit like losers here.

That’s a wrap for today’s game. Tune in next week as we put AI back in the hot seat and ask: Are! You! Smarter! Than! Just googling it!

entry.title: 手機冷卻器製造商需要用所有的冰來冷卻 || Phone cooler makers need to chill with all the ice
entry.summary:
我很確定被凍結對智能手機來説並不好。

我不瞭解你的情況，但是當我遇到令人討厭的發熱手機情況時，我必須擺脫熱量這一刻。

這是怎麼變成這樣的？滾雪球今天亞馬遜上那些極其不切實際的圖片。

圖片：亞馬遜

在我發明的這個場景中，這個Trakxy 遊戲磁性手機散熱器這就是我們的零號病人的樣子。

圖片：亞馬遜

這裏有一些輕微的霜凍和一些冰柱。薰衣草色的冰球並正確猜測其目的，否則，它會通過。

圖片：亞馬遜

當然他們適用於 iPad， 也。

圖片：亞馬遜

對於青少年工程迷在你的生活中。

圖片：亞馬遜

這就是事情真正開始走下坡路的地方。黑鯊聲稱這將使你的手機溫度降低「高達 35°C」。

圖片：亞馬遜

有些人會轉動你的手機進入一個F-零賽車手!

圖片：亞馬遜

至少這個配有暖指器。

圖片：亞馬遜

哎喲!

圖片：亞馬遜

絕對不.

圖片：亞馬遜

就像覆蓋在上面的低不透明度雪花圖案一樣這個.

現在，這是最終的 boss。Yanism 磁性手機散熱器.

圖片：亞馬遜

---------------

I’m pretty sure being frozen isn’t great for smartphones.

I don’t know about you, but when I have a nasty case of the hot phone, I have to get rid of that heat this instant. Just kidding, I usually just put it down for a while or restart it when it’s being especially stubborn. But there are companies out there marketing a different solution: little stick-on phone-cooling fans that purport to draw all that heat away. And their product images are a little, uh, excessively icy.

How did it come to this? What kicked off this arms race of increasingly frosty phones? I have to assume things started innocently enough, but these RGB-riddled things are pretty squarely aimed at gamers — I’d guess it didn’t take long for these product shots to snowball into the wildly unrealistic pictures on Amazon today.

Image: Amazon

In this scenario I’ve invented, this Trakxy Magnetic Phone Cooler for Gaming is what our patient zero would look like. The tasteful use of a blue phone and blue highlights circling the fan tells me all I need to know about this magnetically-attached fan.

Image: Amazon

Some mild frost here and some icicles. Maybe a bit excessive, but I don’t think I’d look at this lavender-colored puck and correctly guess its purpose otherwise, so it gets a pass.

Image: Amazon

Of course they have them for iPads, too. At first glance, this picture is pretty harmless. Until you look at the digital display. Is Teesso claiming this thing will drop your tablet to five below zero? I’m not sure I want that!

Image: Amazon

For the Teenage Engineering fan in your life.

Image: Amazon

Here’s where things really start to go downhill. Black Shark claims this will drop your phone’s temperature by 「up to 35°C.」

Image: Amazon

Some of them turn your phone into an F-Zero racer!

Image: Amazon

At least this one comes with finger warmers. Very considerate.

Image: Amazon

Ouch!

Image: Amazon

Absolutely not.

Image: Amazon

Like the low-opacity snowflake pattern overlaid on this one.

And now, here is the final boss. The phone cooler to end all phone coolers. One that nobody has ever written a bad review of because their fingers are too frozen to do so. I present the Yanism Magnetic Cell Phone Cooler.

Image: Amazon

entry.title: 谷歌正式成為一家價值 2 萬億美元的公司 || Google is officially a $2 trillion company
entry.summary:
Alphabet 的市值在 2021 年曾一度達到 2T 美元，但現在一整天都輕鬆突破了這一門檻。

谷歌在過去的一年裏一直在處理兩個問題25 年曆史上最大的威脅：生成式人工智能的興起和監管的不斷加強。大搜索變化，重新調整了搜索, Android 和硬件團隊圍繞人工智能，推出了自己的雙子座人工智能模型利用這個機會。

谷歌高管削減項目並下崗員工重新聚焦，昨天，它宣佈其有史以來的第一次股息並在 2024 年第一季度盈利的同時進行 700 億美元的股票回購。

至少投資者正在大吃一驚：谷歌母公司 Alphabet 終於正式達到並維持全天交易市值 2 萬億美元在短暫觸及 2 萬億美元之後2021 年 11 月。谷歌是全球第四大最有價值的上市公司，僅次於英偉達（2.2 萬億美元）、蘋果（2.6 萬億美元）和微軟（3.0 萬億美元）。

圖：谷歌

與 Meta 不同，Meta 的股價在發佈後下跌了 10%馬克·扎克伯格表示，「大規模」押注生成人工智能需要數年時間才能賺錢谷歌昨天表示，它已經找到了一些小方法來銷售它——例如，它正在幫助廣告商在其效果最大化工具中利用人工智能來定位目標人羣，而這些廣告商「發佈具有良好或出色廣告強度的廣告活動的可能性要高出 63%」

該公司還表示，Discover Financial 正在向近 10,000 名呼叫中心代理推出人工智能工具，並且宜家看到「基於價值的出價解決方案」的一種收入形式有所增加。

目前，谷歌表示，它不想對搜索造成太大影響：「我們正在衡量如何做到這一點，重點關注 Gen AI 可以改善搜索體驗的領域，同時也優先考慮網站和商家的流量。」

谷歌現有業務似乎也表現不錯：根據該公司的數據，該公司的利潤為 237 億美元，收入為 805 億美元。2024 年第一季度收益報告它昨天發佈了。假日季當搜索和廣告收入都較高時。

而谷歌可能裁減了一千多名員工為了幫助提高利潤，裁員似乎已經放緩或暫停。我們上季度報告了谷歌僅在 1 月份就在裁員上花費了 7 億美元，然而，新的第一季度報告顯示，谷歌在 1 月、2 月和 3 月的「遣散費和相關費用」上僅花費了 7.16 億美元。

谷歌首席業務官表示，第一季度搜索和廣告收入同比分別增長 14%，YouTube 廣告增長近 21%，「訂閲、平台和設備」同比增長 18%，這主要歸功於 YouTube 的付費訂閲像素 8銷售量）。

谷歌表示正在提高其能力挑戰 TikTok 和 Instagram ReelsSchindler 還談到了上傳 YouTube Shorts 短片的創作者數量增加了 50%，以及 Shorts 的變現率僅比上個季度就增長了 12%。

谷歌將舉辦其開發者大會 Google I/O，5 月 14 日.


---------------

Alphabet’s market cap briefly hit $2T in 2021 — but now it’s comfortably passed the threshold for an entire day.

Google has spent the past year dealing with two of the biggest threats in its 25-year history: the rise of generative AI and the growing drumbeat of regulation. AI, in particular, has shaken the company to its core: it’s made big search changes, realigned the Search, Android, and hardware teams around AI, and launched its own Gemini AI model to capitalize on the opportunity.

Google execs cut projects and laid off employees to refocus, and yesterday, it announced its first-ever dividend and a $70 billion share buyback alongside its Q1 2024 earnings.

Investors, at least, are eating it up: Google parent company Alphabet has finally officially hit and maintained a $2 trillion market cap for a whole day of trading after briefly touching $2 trillion in November 2021. Google is the fourth most valuable public company in the world, behind Nvidia ($2.2 trillion), Apple ($2.6 trillion), and Microsoft ($3.0 trillion). Amazon is currently at $1.8 trillion, and Meta is at $1.1 trillion.

Graph: Google

Unlike Meta, whose stock price fell 10 percent after Mark Zuckerberg said it would take years to make money in 「massive」 bets on generative AI, Google said yesterday that it’s already finding some small ways to sell it — for example, it’s helping advertisers target people with AI in its Performance Max tool and that those advertisers are 「63 percent more likely to publish a campaign with good or excellent ad strength.」

The company also says Discover Financial is rolling out AI tools to nearly 10,000 call center agents and that Ikea is seeing an increase in one form of revenue from 「value-based bidding solutions.」 And while it’s not yet talking about monetizing AI answers in Google Search, CEO Sundar Pichai said, 「...we are very confident we can manage the cost of how to serve these queries.」

For now, Google says it doesn’t want to disrupt search too much: 「We’re being measured in how we do this, focusing on areas where Gen AI can improve the search experience while also prioritizing traffic to websites and merchants,」 said Pichai.

Google’s existing businesses seem to be doing just fine, too: the company made $23.7 billion in profit on $80.5 billion in revenue, according to the Q1 2024 earnings report it released yesterday. Not only is that 15 percent more revenue year over year — it’s 14 percent more profit than it made during the holiday quarter when search and ad revenue were both a bit higher.

And while Google may have cut a thousand-plus employees to help boost those profits, it seems layoffs may have slowed or paused. We reported last quarter that Google spent $700 million on layoffs in January alone, and yet, the new Q1 report shows Google only spent $716 million on 「severance and related charges」 across January, February, and March.

Q1 search and advertising revenue were each up 14 percent year over year, YouTube ads were up nearly 21 percent, and 「subscriptions, platforms, and devices」 were up 18 percent year over year — mostly due to premium YouTube subscriptions, said Google chief business officer Philipp Schindler (so not necessarily Pixel 8 sales).

Google said it’s improving its ability to challenge TikTok and Instagram Reels, too, with Schindler talking about how 50 percent more creators are uploading YouTube Shorts shortform videos and how the monetization rate of Shorts has increased 12 percent over the last quarter alone.

Google will host its developer conference, Google I/O, on May 14th.

entry.title: 如何刪除 Google 擁有的關於您的數據 || How to delete the data Google has on you
entry.summary:
您可以手動刪除您的信息，也可以要求 Google 在您之後進行清理。

想想你在 Chrome、Gmail、Google 地圖、YouTube 以及 Google 擁有的其他所有東西上所做的一切，你就會知道你每天向公司放棄了多少數據。

無論您是否認為數據收集和有針對性的廣告對於您獲得的免費應用程序來説是值得的交易，谷歌至少提供了一個全面的在線儀錶板，您可以使用它來查看正在收集的一些內容。

您可以使用它來刪除 Google 已收集的所有內容、阻止其將來收集任何內容，或者在設定的時間段（例如三個月）後自動刪除您的數據。

以下是如何使用可用的選項。

查找您的數據

入門非常簡單：打開您的谷歌帳戶頁面在您選擇的網絡瀏覽器中，如果需要請登錄。

現在，我們對數據感興趣。

  • 點擊數據和隱私在左側。
  • 尋找歷史設置。
  • 點擊我的活動該部分底部的按鈕可查看此數據的完整列表。
  • 選擇按日期和產品過濾將結果限制為特定日期範圍或特定應用程序。
  • 要刪除已應用的過濾器，請單擊X位於列表頂部的旁邊。
  • 單擊列表中的任何條目即可查看有關該條目的更多詳細信息（如果有）。

刪除您的數據

當涉及到 Google 已經收集和記錄的數據時，您可以通過幾種不同的方式刪除它。

  • 如果您正在查看完整的活動列表，請單擊刪除（在過濾器的右側）。總是刪除所有內容。
  • 如果您已按日期或產品過濾列表，請單擊刪除結果：這會擦除與過濾器匹配的所有內容。
  • 無論是否過濾列表，您都可以單擊X旁邊的任何單個條目將其刪除。

通過一個門戶網站提供所有數據的中央存儲庫非常方便，但您也可以在其他地方找到某些類型的數據。從 Chrome 內部例如，只要您登錄 Google，或者訪問您的 YouTube 觀看歷史記錄通過 YouTube 網站。

自動刪除並關閉數據收集

如果您希望 Google 自動刪除您的數據或完全停止收集數據，則需要使用我們之前提到的三個類別：網絡和應用程序、位置和 YouTube。

從活動列表中，單擊網絡和應用程序活動, 位置記錄， 或者YouTube 歷史。

  • 點擊關停止收集此特定類別的數據。關（保留迄今為止收集的所有內容）或關閉並刪除活動. 
  • 如果您選擇刪除數據，在確認操作之前，您將看到要刪除的內容的預覽。
  • 在頁面下方，選擇選擇自動刪除選項在一定時間後擦除該類別中的數據：3 個月, 18 個月， 或者36 個月.

您還會在這些屏幕上看到一些子設置，例如您在 YouTube 上運行的搜索或可能通過與 Google Assistant 交互收集的語音和音頻活動。

顯然這裏需要考慮一些妥協。

自動刪除選項在這方面提供了很好的平衡，因為這意味着您確實獲得了一定程度的個性化，而無需將所有活動始終保存在 Google 服務器上。

順便説一句，如果您嘗試關閉任何此類數據收集（或重新打開），Google 將彈出一個信息面板，解釋其收集的數據如何幫助您跨多個應用程序提供個性化服務。


---------------

You can get rid of your info manually or ask Google to clean up after you.

Think about everything you do across Chrome, Gmail, Google Maps, YouTube, and everything else Google owns, and you get some idea of how much data you’re giving up to the company each day. For most of us, it’s... a lot.

Whether or not you think the data collection and targeted advertising is a worthwhile trade for the free apps you get in return, Google does at least provide a comprehensive online dashboard you can use to see some of what’s being gathered.

You can use it to delete everything Google has already collected, stop it from collecting anything in the future, or automatically delete your data after a set period (like three months). You can also use these features to clear the records if you’re planning to delete your Google account — though the process of deleting it should also wipe all of the data associated with your account.

Here’s how to use the options available to you.

Find your data

Getting started is pretty easy: Open your Google account page in a web browser of your choice, signing in if you need to. From this screen, you can see your Google subscriptions, the devices you’re signed in to with your Google account, and the passwords you might have saved, among other information.

Right now, we’re interested in data.

  • Click Data and privacy on the left. 
  • Look for History settings. It is split up into three main categories: Web and apps, location, and YouTube.
  • Click the My Activity button at the bottom of that section to see a complete list of this data. You’ll see everything you’ve done that’s been logged in Google products, starting with what’s most recent.
  • Select Filter by date & product to limit the results to certain date ranges or certain apps.
  • To remove a filter you’ve applied, click the X next to it at the top of the list.
  • Click on any entry in the list to see more details about it if they’re available. You can open YouTube videos you’ve watched, for example, or websites you’ve visited.

Delete your data

When it comes to data that’s already been collected and logged by Google, you can erase it in a few different ways.

  • If you’re looking at the full activity list, click Delete (to the right of the filter). You can wipe records from the last hour, the last day, or within a custom range. You can also click Always to delete everything.
  • If you’ve filtered the list by date or product, click Delete results: this wipes everything that matches the filter.
  • Whether or not the list is filtered, you can click the X next to any single entry to delete it.

It’s handy to have this central repository of all your data available via one web portal, but you can find some types of data in other places, too. You can delete your web activity from inside Chrome as long as you’re signed in to Google, for example, or get at your YouTube watch history through the YouTube website.

Auto-delete and turn off data collection

If you want Google to auto-delete your data or stop collecting data altogether, you need to use the three categories we mentioned earlier: Web and apps, location, and YouTube.

From the activity list, click Web & App Activity, Location History, or YouTube History. The next options screen you’ll see is very similar across all three categories:

  • Click Turn off to stop collecting data in this particular category. If you select this option, you can choose to either Turn off (to keep anything collected thus far) or Turn off and delete activity. 
  • If you choose to delete data, you’ll be shown a preview of what’s getting erased before you confirm the action.
  • Further down the page, select Choose an auto-delete option to have the data in this category wiped after a certain time: 3 months, 18 months, or 36 months.

You’ll also see some sub-settings on these screens, too, such as searches you run on YouTube or voice and audio activity that might be collected through your interactions with Google Assistant.

There are obviously some compromises to think about here. If you’ve been checking out a particular coffee shop on Google Maps, it is helpful to have it pop up automatically when you need to get directions to it. In the same way, if you like a couple of YouTube videos, then you probably want to see more videos along the same lines rather than something served up randomly.

The auto-delete option offers a good balance in this regard because it means you do get some level of personalization without having all of your activities saved on Google’s servers for all time.

Incidentally, if you try to turn off any of this data collection (or turn it back on), Google will throw up an information panel explaining how the data it gathers helps to personalize services for you across multiple apps. In other words, Google definitely wants you to allow it to collect this data, but in the end, it’s your choice.

entry.title: 谷歌為英語學習者增加人工智能對話練習 || Google adds AI conversation practice for English language learners
entry.summary:
口語練習功能創建了一個人工智能機器人，可以與正在學習説英語的用戶保持對話。

谷歌正在測試其人工智能聽力技能，該功能可以讓人們對着手機説話，並通過對話式人工智能機器人練習英語。2023 年 10 月口語練習經歷。

TechCrunch報告該功能目前可供阿根廷、哥倫比亞、印度、墨西哥、委內瑞拉和印度尼西亞的搜索實驗室用戶使用。

目前，反饋和對話練習功能僅提供英語版本。

谷歌沒有像 Duolingo、Babbel、Pimsleur 或其他語言學習應用程序那樣的課程或系統來提升學生的水平。其人工智能模型能夠理解的語言數量.   

人工智能輔助語言學習並不新鮮。 2016 年人工智能聊天機器人和2023 年集成 GPT-4。Memrise，推出了基於 GPT-3 的聊天機器人Discord 可以讓人們在聊天的同時學習語言。還提供對話練習。

作為一名狂熱的 Duolingo 用戶（連續 947 天西班牙語），獲得反饋並練習在實際對話中説我正在學習的語言對我來説至關重要。Duo，Duolingo 的貓頭鷹吉祥物，他的靴子可能會發抖。


---------------

The speaking practice feature creates an AI bot that keeps up a conversation with users who are learning to speak English.

Google is testing its AI listening skills with a feature that lets people speak into their phones and practice English with a conversational AI bot. Google first rolled out the speaking practice experience in October 2023. Originally, the feature only provided feedback on spoken sentences. Now, users can practice having ongoing conversations in the language they’re learning.

TechCrunch reports that the feature is currently available for Search Labs users in Argentina, Colombia, India, Mexico, Venezuela, and Indonesia. Search Labs is Google’s sandbox for potential new Search features; however, the feature may also pop up based on translating to or from English with Google on an Android device. 

For now, the feedback and conversation practice features are only available in English. Google said in its 2023 blog that Search is a 「valuable tool for language learners」 because they can get translations and definitions and search for vocabulary.

Google doesn’t have a curriculum or a system that levels up students like Duolingo, Babbel, Pimsleur, or other language learning apps. When it launched speaking practice, the company said it helps learners not just practice but also figure out the best words or conjugations to use within the context of a conversation. While Google has had a translation feature for years, the company has also been growing the number of languages its AI models understand.   

AI-assisted language learning is not new. Duolingo, arguably the most popular language learning app, added an AI chatbot in 2016 and integrated GPT-4 in 2023. Another online language learning platform, Memrise, launched a GPT-3-based chatbot on Discord that lets people learn languages while chatting. Other language learning platforms also offer conversation practice. For example, Pimsleur asks users to roleplay a conversation with the app, prompting people to respond to questions in their target language. 

As an avid Duolingo user (947-day Spanish streak), it is crucial for me to get feedback and practice speaking the languages I’m learning in actual conversations. Google hasn’t said what its plans for language learning are or if the speaking practice feature will be expanded to more countries, but Duo, the owl mascot of Duolingo, could be shaking in his boots.

entry.title: 谷歌 Pixel 8A 泄密揭示了七年的安全更新 || Google Pixel 8A leak reveals seven years of security updates
entry.summary:
不過，它可能不會伴隨七年的 Android 操作系統升級。

我們已經看到了一堆圖像揭示谷歌 Pixel 8A 可能的樣子，但現在，泄露的營銷材料通過共享安卓頭條讓我們更好地瞭解我們可以期待什麼。

但這些材料並沒有表明這款手機是否會配備七年的 Android 操作系統升級，這是它的事情。旗艦 Pixel 8 和 8 Pro 有。

圖像：安卓頭條

除此之外，分享的材料安卓頭條建議 Pixel 8A 將配備與 Pixel 8 和 8 Pro 相同的 G3 Tensor 處理器。噪音消除功能讓通話更清晰。照片重新混合選項最好的選擇。

---------------

It might not come with seven years of Android OS upgrades, though.

We’ve already seen a bunch of images revealing what Google’s Pixel 8A might look like, but now, leaked marketing materials shared by Android Headlines give us an even better picture of what we can expect. entry.title: 如何停止想起你不想被想起的記憶 || How to stop being reminded of memories you don’t want to be reminded of
entry.summary:
谷歌、蘋果、微軟和 Facebook 都有記憶提醒功能——如果你不喜歡它們，可以將其關閉。

去年，在一個完美的春日，也恰好是我的生日，我開車去了紐約州一個美麗的地區。

不幸的是，我去北部旅行的原因不是為了觀賞動植物，而是為了參加我最好朋友的葬禮。

一年後，不出所料，谷歌出現在我的通知中，邀請我重溫那天的「美好」回憶。

我很確定我不是唯一一個發現這些彈出窗口不再是一種快樂，而是一支直入你內心的情感箭頭的人。

當然，您可以通過退出互聯網或將所有通知靜音來避免這些通知 - 但如果您有想要保持聯繫的朋友或對您很重要的通知，那就行不通了。喜歡出現一些記憶提醒——但不是全部。

也許因為 一切 投訴，一些更嚴重的違規者——Google Photos、Apple Photos、Facebook 和 Microsoft OneDrive——有辦法阻止它們出現。

以下是如何控制這四個應用程序中不想要的記憶。

谷歌照片

您可以調整 Google 相冊中的回憶功能來停止特定的照片組或使其完全停止。

（是的，如果谷歌最新的人工智能功能——那就太好了——不管他們想怎麼稱呼它- 只需一個請求即可為您完成此操作，但與許多其他事情一樣，人工智能還沒有完全實現.)

在桌面應用程序中：

  • 去設置（右上角的齒輪）並向下滾動到回憶.
  • 如果您不想提醒某個特定日期（或多個特定日期），請選擇隱藏日期 > 添加日期並添加您想要避免的日期（或日期範圍）。
  • 如果您不想提醒某個特定的人或寵物，請選擇隱藏人和寵物。
  • 如果您根本不需要任何彈出記憶，請禁用基於時間的記憶和主題回憶.

在移動應用程序中：

  • 點擊您的個人圖標（位於右上角）並照片設置 > 首選項.
  • 選擇回憶.
  • 選擇隱藏人或者隱藏日期停止對特定人或日期的記憶。
  • 要禁用彈出記憶，請選擇通知並禁用基於時間的記憶或者主題回憶.

蘋果照片

如果您使用 Apple Photos iPhone 應用程序，您可以通過多種方式通過該應用程序的「回憶」功能來減少或阻止不需要的人物或事件突然出現。

要控制您查看特定人、寵物或其他內容的頻率：

  • 在裏面相片應用程序，找到您不想被提醒的人的照片。
  • 點擊右上角的三個點並選擇少介紹這個人.
  • 選擇少介紹這個人或者切勿以此人為特色.

如果您想讓某些內容更少出現：

  • 前往為你標籤進入蘋果照片，選擇一個內存，然後點擊右上角的三個點。
  • 輕按功能較少進而確認.

如果你是那種因為被假日照片轟炸而感到惱火的人（相信我，我很同情），那麼你可以在主要設置中專門停止這些：

  • 在設置， 選擇相片.
  • 向下滾動到顯示節日活動並將其關閉。

只要你在那裏——如果你想關閉回憶完全在你的 iPhone 上（這也會切斷精選照片):

  • 去設置 > 照片.
  • 向下滾動到顯示特色內容並將其關閉。

Facebook

是的，我知道——這是 Facebook。

使用桌面應用程序：

  • 在側面菜單中，選擇回憶 > 通知.
  • 如果您想完全停止回憶，請選擇沒有任何在下面通知. 
  • 如果您想停止特定人物或日期的記憶，或使用關鍵字，請轉到隱藏回憶在頁面下方並選擇適當的類別。

使用移動應用程序：

  • 點擊右上角的個人圖標，然後選擇回憶.
  • 選擇設置（齒輪）圖標。
  • 如果您想完全停止回憶，請選擇沒有任何在下面通知. 
  • 如果您想停止特定人物或日期的記憶，或使用關鍵字，請查找隱藏回憶在頁面下方並選擇適當的類別。

一個驅動器

微軟也不甘落後，提供了 OneDrive Memories。

在網上：

  • 您可以直接訪問 OneDrive通知選項由轉到此鏈接;選項 > 通知. 
  • 您會看到多種選擇何時給我發送電子郵件。在這一天，回憶可以被喚起.

使用移動應用程序：

  • 在移動應用程序上，點擊我（右下角您的個人圖標），然後設置 > 通知.
  • 然後您可以禁用通知在這一天和上個月的回憶.

---------------

Google, Apple, Microsoft, and Facebook all have memory reminders — and they can be turned off if you don’t like them.

Last year, on a perfect spring day that also happened to be my birthday, I took a car trip to a beautiful area of New York state. It was a lovely day. The new foliage was just coming out and flocks of migrating birds were flying overhead — just the right day for a bunch of photos and good memories.

Unfortunately, my reason for traveling upstate wasn’t for the flora and fauna, but to attend the funeral of my best friend. I took lots of photos on that day: of other friends who attended the service, of the river paths and local parks that my best friend and I used to walk together, and of the home she used to share with her parents, now empty. I took all of those photos because I knew it was probably the last time that I would visit that place. 

And one year later, predictably, Google popped up in my notifications with an invitation to revisit the 「wonderful」 memories of that day. It was not something I needed — or wanted — a reminder of, especially a peppy reminder that assumed I had a wonderful time and wanted to share all those exhilarating memories with all my friends.

I’m pretty sure I’m not the only one who finds these pop-ups less of a joy and more of an emotional arrow headed into your heart.

Of course, you can avoid these notifications by just pulling out of the internet or muting all of your notifications — but if you’ve got friends you want to keep in touch with or notifications that are important to you, that won’t work. In addition, you may like having some of these memory reminders appear — just not all of them. What if, say, you want to simply avoid photos of an ex or of the trip where you made a total fool of yourself?

Perhaps because of all the complaints, some of the more egregious offenders — Google Photos, Apple Photos, Facebook, and Microsoft OneDrive — have ways that you can stop them from appearing. Depending on the app, you can tweak your settings to avoid specific memory notifications — or stop them altogether.

Here is how to rein in unwanted memories from these four apps.

Google Photos

You can tweak the Memories feature in Google Photos to stop specific groups of photos or bring it to a total halt. The process differs depending on whether you’re using a desktop or mobile app.

(Yes, it would be nice if Google’s latest AI feature — whatever they want to call it — could do this for you with a single request, but as with so many other things, AI is not quite there yet.)

In the desktop app:

  • Go to Settings (the cog in the upper-right corner) and scroll down to Memories.
  • If there is a specific date that you don’t want to be reminded of (or several specific dates), select Hide dates > Add dates and add the date (or date range) you want to avoid.
  • If there is a specific person or pet you don’t want to be reminded of, select Hide people & pets. You’ll see a collection of all the faces that Photos has found in your images. Click on one you don’t want to see, and it will be grayed out with a 「don’t see」 symbol. Click on it again if you want to restore it.
  • If you don’t want any pop-up memories at all, disable Time-based memories and Themed memories.

In the mobile app:

  • Tap your personal icon (in the upper-right corner) and Photos settings > Preferences.
  • Select Memories.
  • Choose Hide people or Hide dates to stop memories of specific people or dates. (These work in the same way as the 「hide」 feature in the desktop app.)
  • To disable pop-up memories, select Notifications and disable Time-based memories or Themed memories.

Apple Photos

If you use the Apple Photos iPhone app, there are a variety of ways you can lessen or stop people or events from popping up when they’re not wanted via the app’s Memories features.

To control how often you see a specific person, pet, or other content:

  • In the Photos app, find a picture of the person you don’t want to be reminded of.
  • Tap the three dots in the top-right corner and select Feature This Person Less.
  • Select Feature This Person Less or Never Feature This Person.

If you want to make certain content appear less often:

  • Go to the For You tab in Apple Photos, select a memory, and tap the three dots in the upper-right corner.
  • Tap on Feature Less and then Confirm.

If you’re the kind of person who gets irritated by being bombarded with holiday photos (and believe me, I sympathize), then you can specifically stop those in your main settings:

  • In Settings, select Photos.
  • Scroll down to Show Holiday Events and toggle it off. 

And as long as you’re there — if you want to turn off Memories altogether on your iPhone (which will also cut off Featured Photos):

  • Go to Settings > Photos.
  • Scroll down to Show Featured Content and toggle it off.

Facebook

Yeah, I know — it’s Facebook. But it’s also where a lot of your relatives are, so it’s hard to let it go. But you don’t have to let it constantly remind you of things you don’t want to be reminded of.

Using the desktop app:

  • In the side menu, select Memories > Notifications.
  • If you want to stop Memories altogether, select None under Notifications. 
  • If you want to stop Memories of specific people or dates, or using keywords, go to Hide Memories lower down on the page and select the appropriate category.

Using the mobile app:

  • Tap your personal icon in the upper-right corner, and select Memories.
  • Select the Settings (cog) icon.
  • If you want to stop Memories altogether, select None under Notifications. 
  • If you want to stop Memories of specific people or dates, or using keywords, look for Hide Memories lower down on the page and select the appropriate category.

OneDrive

Microsoft, not to be left behind, offers OneDrive Memories. Luckily, it’s easy to turn off.

On the web:

  • You can go directly to OneDrive’s Notifications option by going to this link; otherwise, if you’re using the website, click on the cog in the upper-right corner and go to Options > Notifications. 
  • You’ll see several choices for Send me email when. Uncheck the box next to On this day memories are available.

Using the mobile app:

  • On the mobile app, tap Me (your personal icon in the lower-right corner), then Settings > Notifications.
  • You can then disable notifications for On this day and Memories from last month.

entry.title: 谷歌最終將把 Keep 提醒放在它們一直所屬的任務中 || Google will finally put Keep reminders in Tasks, where they always belonged
entry.summary:
您很快就可以在 Google Tasks 中管理您的提醒。

您在 Google Keep 中記下的提醒很快就會顯示在「任務」中。谷歌説期待已久的集成將於明年推出，讓您可以跨任務、日曆和助手查看、編輯和完成 Keep 提醒。

這一變化將使任務成為所有待辦事項和提醒的中心樞紐，有望使它們更易於管理。Google 升級版 Keep 應用去年，他説：「現在，谷歌，讓 Keep 提醒出現在任務中。

圖片：谷歌

儘管 Tasks 不像 Keep 那樣支持基於位置的提醒，但 Google 表示（指 Keep）您仍然可以「向任何筆記添加基於時間或位置的提醒」。

在過去的一年裏，谷歌一直致力於使其任務應用程序更加有用——或者正如大衞所説，「終於有點好」。包括來自 Google 助理和日曆的提醒2023 年 3 月，與 Keep 的集成只會使其成為更實用的生產力應用程序。


---------------

You’ll soon be able to manage your reminders in Google Tasks.

The reminders you’ve jotted down in Google Keep will soon show up in Tasks. Google says the long-requested integration is coming over the next year, allowing you to see, edit, and complete your Keep reminders across Tasks, Calendar, and Assistant.

The change will make Tasks the central hub for all to-dos and reminders, hopefully making them far easier to manage. It’s something my colleague David Pierce suggested when talking about Google’s upgraded Keep app last year, saying, 「Now, Google, make Keep reminders show up in Tasks. It’s right there!」

Image: Google

Even though Tasks doesn’t support location-based reminders like Keep does, Google states (referring to Keep) that you can still 「add time or location-based reminders to any note.」

Over the past year, Google has been working to make its Tasks app more useful — or 「finally kind of good,」 as David put it. It started including reminders from Assistant and Calendar in March 2023, and the integration with Keep should only make it a more practical productivity app.
